event: Pedro Álvares Cabral lands in Brazil and claims it for Portugal
Portugal begins colonization to secure territory
Salvador founded as first capital of colonial Brazil
Iberian Union begins; Portugal and its colonies under Spanish crown
Dutch invade and occupy parts of northeastern Brazil
Portuguese restore control over Brazil after end of Iberian Union
Discovery of gold in Minas Gerais triggers gold rush
Portuguese royal court relocates to Brazil fleeing Napoleon
Brazil elevated to status of United Kingdom with Portugal
Dom Pedro I declares Brazil's independence from Portugal
First constitution of the Empire of Brazil enacted
Slavery abolished by Princess Isabel
Monarchy overthrown; Brazil becomes a republic
Getúlio Vargas seizes power in coup, beginning authoritarian rule
End of Estado Novo regime; return to democratic rule
Military coup installs dictatorship lasting until 1985
Return to civilian government; José Sarney becomes president
New democratic constitution enacted
Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva elected president
Dilma Rousseff becomes Brazil's first female president
Rousseff impeached; Michel Temer becomes president
Jair Bolsonaro elected president
Lula da Silva re-elected as president
